text.text_translated: An asteroid is a small space rock that travels around the Sun. NASA is now working to record some of the smaller ones. These asteroids measure 140 metres wide or more. Scientists estimate there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, only about 8,000 have been recorded. That leaves around 17,000 not yet recorded. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the Russian city of Chelyabinsk and injured 1,200 people. This shows that even a small object can be dangerous. These middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
